page.title: 03HEALTH
page.content: {Forth Park Maternity Hospital}was built in 1935 to replace Stanley Park which was the Maternity Home in Kirkcaldy.When the National Health Service started in 1948 there were 16 nursing staff.Now there are 67. As very few babies are born at home now the 75 Antenatal and Postnatal beds are in constant use. The Hospital is equipped with a great deal of{modern equipment including monitors to record the babies heart beats, 25 special care cots,4 intensive care cots and 8 observation beds. The original building has now been adapted for{Geriatric}accommodation.It contains 30 beds for long-term care of the elderly. {A College of Nursing and Midwifery is in the process of being built on an available site behind the station.
